Package org.webpki.json

Class JSONObjectReader

java.lang.Object
org.webpki.json.JSONObjectReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class JSONObjectReader
extends Object
implements Cloneable
JSON object reader.

Returned by the parser methods. Also provides built-in support for decoding JSF (JSON Signature Format) and JEF (JSON Encryption Format) constructs.

In addition, there are methods for reading keys supplied in the JWK (JSON Web Key) format.

See Also:
JSONParser, getObject(String), JSONArrayReader.getObject(), JSONObjectWriter(JSONObjectReader)

  • Constructor Summary

    Create a JSON object reader from of a writer.

  • Method Details

    • checkForUnread

      public void checkForUnread() throws IOException
      Check for unread data. Throws an exception if any property or array element in the current object or child objects have not been read.
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      scanAway(String), getPropertyType(String), getProperties()

    • getInt

      public int getInt​(String name) throws IOException
      Read a JSON integer property.

      This method only accepts true integer values. I.e. 10.4 would throw an exception.

      Parameters:
      name - Property
      Returns:
      Java int
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.setInt(String, int)

    • getInt53

      public long getInt53​(String name) throws IOException
      Read a JSON long integer property.

      This method only accepts true integer values. I.e. 10.4 would throw an exception.

      Note: Only 53 bits of precision is available, values outside this range throw exceptions.

      Parameters:
      name - Property
      Returns:
      Java long
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.setInt53(String, long), JSONObjectWriter.MAX_INTEGER, getBigInteger(String)

    • getLong

      public long getLong​(String name) throws IOException
      Read a JSON long integer property.

      This method only accepts true integer values. I.e. 10.4 would throw an exception.

      Note: The value is put within quotes to maintain full 64-bit precision which does not have a native counterpart in JavaScript.

      Parameters:
      name - Property
      Returns:
      Java long
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.setLong(String, long), getBigInteger(String), getInt53(String)

    • getDateTime

      public GregorianCalendar getDateTime​(String name, EnumSet<ISODateTime.DatePatterns> format) throws IOException
      Read a JSON dateTime property in ISO format.

      Note: Since JSON does not support a native dateTime type, this method builds on mapping.

      Parameters:
      name - Property
      format - Required input format
      Returns:
      Java GregorianCalendar
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      ISODateTime.parseDateTime(String, EnumSet), JSONObjectWriter.setDateTime(String, GregorianCalendar, EnumSet)

    • getJSONArrayReader

      public JSONArrayReader getJSONArrayReader()
      Get root array reader.

      If the outermost part of the JSON structure is an array, this method must be called immediately after parsing in order to process the structure.

      Returns:
      Array reader if array else null
      See Also:
      JSONArrayWriter()

    • getIfNULL

      public boolean getIfNULL​(String name) throws IOException
      Conditionally read a JSON null property.

      Note: Only if the property contains a null the property is marked as "read".

      Parameters:
      name - Property
      Returns:
      true if null was found, else false
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      checkForUnread()

    • getPublicKey

      public PublicKey getPublicKey​(AlgorithmPreferences algorithmPreferences) throws IOException
      Read and decode a public key in JSF (JWK) format.
      Parameters:
      algorithmPreferences - JOSE or SKS notation expected
      Returns:
      Java PublicKey
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.setPublicKey(PublicKey)

    • getPublicKey

      public PublicKey getPublicKey() throws IOException
      Read and decode a public key in JSF (JWK) format. This method is equivalent to getPublicKey(AlgorithmPreferences.JOSE).
      Returns:
      Java PublicKey
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.setPublicKey(PublicKey)

    • getCorePublicKey

      public PublicKey getCorePublicKey​(AlgorithmPreferences algorithmPreferences) throws IOException
      Read and decode a public key in JSF (JWK) format. Note: this method assumes that the current object only holds the actual public key structure (no property).
      Parameters:
      algorithmPreferences - JOSE or SKS notation expected
      Returns:
      Java PublicKey
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.createCorePublicKey(PublicKey,AlgorithmPreferences)

    • getKeyPair

      public KeyPair getKeyPair​(AlgorithmPreferences algorithmPreferences) throws IOException
      Read a public and private key in JWK format.

      Note: this method assumes that the current object only holds a JWK key structure.

      Parameters:
      algorithmPreferences - JOSE or SKS notation expected
      Returns:
      Java KeyPair
      Throws:
      IOException -  

    • getKeyPair

      public KeyPair getKeyPair() throws IOException
      Read a public and private key in JWK format.

      Note: this method assumes that the current object only holds a JWK key structure.

      This method is equivalent to getKeyPair(AlgorithmPreferences.JOSE).
      Returns:
      Java KeyPair
      Throws:
      IOException -  

    • getEncryptionObject

      public JSONDecryptionDecoder getEncryptionObject​(JSONCryptoHelper.Options options) throws IOException
      Read an object in JEF format.

      Note: this method assumes that the current object only holds a JEF structure.

      Parameters:
      options - Restrictions and requirements
      Returns:
      An object which can be used to retrieve the original (unencrypted) data
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.createEncryptionObject(byte[],DataEncryptionAlgorithms,JSONEncrypter), JSONCryptoHelper.Options

    • getEncryptionObjects

      public ArrayList<JSONDecryptionDecoder> getEncryptionObjects​(JSONCryptoHelper.Options options) throws IOException
      Read an object in JEF format intended for multiple recipients.

      Note: this method assumes that the current object only holds a JEF structure.

      Parameters:
      options - Global restrictions and requirements
      Returns:
      An object which can be used to retrieve the original (unencrypted) data
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.createEncryptionObject(byte[],DataEncryptionAlgorithms,JSONEncrypter), JSONCryptoHelper.Options

    • getCertificatePath

      public X509Certificate[] getCertificatePath() throws IOException
      Read a certificate path in JSF format.

      The array elements (base64url encoded certificates), must be supplied in strict issuance order where certificate[i] is signed by certificate[i + 1].

      Returns:
      Certificate path
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      JSONObjectWriter.setCertificatePath(X509Certificate[])

    • scanAway

      public JSONObjectReader scanAway​(String name) throws IOException
      Scan a property. This method scans a property regardless of its type and it useful for dealing with data where the type is unknown. It also marks the property as "read" including possible child objects and arrays.
      Parameters:
      name - Property
      Returns:
      Current instance of JSONObjectReader
      Throws:
      IOException -  
      See Also:
      checkForUnread(), getPropertyType(String), getProperties()

      public JSONObjectReader removeProperty​(String name) throws IOException
      Remove a property.
      Parameters:
      name - Property
      Returns:
      Current instance of JSONObjectReader
      Throws:
      IOException -
